title: ComparatorOnlyEvidence: Additional GI surgical procedure without bariatric surgery (Control Group) in JAMA 2018 Norwegian cohort study
citeAs: ComparatorOnlyEvidence: Additional GI surgical procedure without bariatric surgery (Control Group) in JAMA 2018 Norwegian cohort study [Database Entry: FHIR Evidence Resource]. Contributors: Brian S. Alper [Authors/Creators]. In: Fast Evidence Interoperability Resources (FEvIR) Platform, FOI 104385. Revised 2022-09-19. Available at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/104385. Computable resource at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/104385#json.

statistic.description: 148 out of 956 observed with percentage of: 15.5%

description: Risk of additional GI surgical procedure in control group was 15.5%.

observed.display: ComparatorGroup: JAMA 2018 Norwegian cohort study Control cohort

variableDefinition.description: Cohort study with baseline data of exposures from November 2005 through July 2010 and follow-up data from 2006 until death or through December 2015 at a tertiary care outpatient center, Vestfold Hospital Trust, Norway. Consecutive treatment-seeking adult patients (n = 2109) with severe obesity assessed (221 patients excluded and 1888 patients included). -- Comparator Group assigned to no bariatric surgery (specialized medical treatment without bariatric surgery (control group))

name: ComparatorOnlyEvidence_Additional_GI_surgical_procedure_without_bariatric_surgery_Control_Group_in_JAMA_2018_Norwegian_cohort_study
